question.title: Resizing custom cursor in Java swing
question.body:
I am doing a painting app. I want to have an eraser as a cursor when I am erasing. I can set the picture for it, but the picture is formatted to 32x32 px. But I want it smaller. Does anyone know about some library that can do it? Or some solution?

I have tried to scale the image, but it didn't work. I tried something with bufferedImage, but I don't understand that, because I am only in 2nd grade in middle school.

answers.body:
Just create a resized image in Java

BufferedImage scaleImage(Image im) {
  BufferedImage im2 = new BufferedImage(16,16, BufferedImage.TYPE_4BYTE_RGBA);
  Graphics2D g2 = (Graphics2D) im2.getGraphics();
  g2.scale(.5,.5); // assuming im is 32 x 32
  g2.drawImage(im, null, 0,0);
  g2.dispose();
  return im2;
}

Now set your reduced sized image as the cursor.

question_comments.body: I have tried to scale the image, but it didn't work. - well, we can't guess what you did. All you need to do is used the Image.getScaledImage(...) method. Post your minimal reproducible example that demonstrates your problem. You can also check out: stackoverflow.com/a/50429810/131872 for an example that does custom painting to create a cursor.
